definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]

sentences.english: Third, using new methods of literary criticism in contrast liberal research.
sentences.chinese: 三是运用新批评方法作比较文学研究。

sentences.english: He holds a MA in comparative literature from McGill University in Montréal.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有加拿大麦吉尔大学的比较文学硕士学位。

sentences.english: The fast rising Xiang Army of Comparative Literature becomes the focus of the national and international academic field.
sentences.chinese: 迅速崛起的比较文学湘军已引起国内外学界的瞩目。

sentences.english: Some scholars who study comparative literature and folk tales held a seminar about it.
sentences.chinese: 中外几位比较文学与口传文学研究者就此进行了座谈。

sentences.english: It is this idea that has provided the new foundation to compare literature and history.
sentences.chinese: 正是这种观念为我们比较文学和历史提供了新的基础。

sentences.english: Translation study in the field of comparative literature is on the upswing.
sentences.chinese: 翻译研究在当代比较文学研究中正呈现方兴未艾之势。

sentences.english: The crisis is not only a challenge, but also a chance.
sentences.chinese: 对于中西比较文学来说，危机既是挑战也是机遇。

sentences.english: So the comparative literature research should turn from commonness to difference.
sentences.chinese: 因此，比较文学研究应从共通性转向差异性。

sentences.english: The development of comparative literature has made the traditional impact study face a new issue.
sentences.chinese: 比较文学的发展，使传统的影响研究面临新的课题。
